page.title: 05INTERESTING LOCAL PEOPLE 1
page.content: The Research Team were kindly granted an interview by Sir Leonard and Lady Redshaw, two well known people who have devoted their lives to service to industry and other public callings. The Team being invited into their residence, "Bankfield", asked a number of personal questions which began with Lady Redshaw being asked what she thought of life in the district, to which she replied:"It suits me admirably. Having originally resided in London it was quite a move." She also added that she had lived in the house for thirty years and loved every moment of it and indeed the district in general. Sir Leonard's answer to the same question was:"Good,very good. It is an ideal place, comparatively quiet and satisfies all our requirements."
